DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Boolean
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
        Low [1]
        Medium [3]
        High [5]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Enable Oscillation [OSC]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Disabled [0]
          Enabled [1]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the living room fan and set it to medium speed with oscillation enabled?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the request based on the device structure. The user wants to turn on the fan, set speed to medium, and enable oscillation.

The "Turn On" command sets Power Status to On (1). The "Set Speed" command accepts a parameter from 0 to 5, where Medium speed corresponds to 3. The "Enable Oscillation" command accepts an enum parameter; Enabled is 1.

Step-by-step:
1. Send Turn On command to power on the fan.
2. Send Set Speed command with parameter 3 to set medium speed.
3. Send Enable Oscillation command with parameter 1 to enable oscillation.

Result: Execute ON, SPEED(3), and OSC(1) commands to turn on the fan at medium speed with oscillation enabled.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 100 to 250 Unit °C
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 100 to 250 Unit °C
    Set Timer [SET_TIMER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Start [START]
    Stop [STOP]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
I want to roast chicken at 220 degrees Celsius for 90 minutes. How do I set that up?

The user wants to roast chicken, so the oven mode should be set to Roast (3). The temperature must be set to 220 °C, which is within the allowed range of 100 to 250 °C. The timer should be set to 90 minutes, which is within the 0 to 180 minutes range.

Step-by-step:
1. Use Set Mode command with parameter 3 to select Roast mode.
2. Use Set Temperature command with parameter 220 to set the oven temperature.
3. Use Set Timer command with parameter 90 to set the cooking duration.
4. Use Start command to begin cooking.

Result: Send SET_MODE(3), SET_TEMP(220), SET_TIMER(90), then START commands to roast chicken at 220 °C for 90 minutes.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Brightness [SET_BRT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Color Temperature [SET_CT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Could you brighten the bedroom light to 75% and set the color temperature to 3000 Kelvin?

The user wants to adjust two properties: Brightness to 75% and Color Temperature to 3000 K. Both values are within the specified ranges (Brightness 0-100%, Color Temperature 2700-6500 K).

Step-by-step:
1. Use Set Brightness command with parameter 75 to set brightness.
2. Use Set Color Temperature command with parameter 3000 to adjust the color temperature.

Result: Send SET_BRT(75) and SET_CT(3000) commands to brighten the bedroom light to 75% and set color temperature to 3000 K.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and closed right now?

The user wants to know the current Door Status and Lock Status.

Step-by-step:
1. Use Query Status command to retrieve current Door Status and Lock Status.
2. Check if Door Status equals Closed (0).
3. Check if Lock Status equals Locked (0).

Result: After querying, if Door Status is Closed and Lock Status is Locked, then the garage door is locked and closed. Otherwise, it is not.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***

      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        Disabled [0]

  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn Zone On [ZONE_ON]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Turn Zone Off [ZONE_OFF]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Set Flow Rate [SET_FLOW]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 20 Unit liters/min
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCH]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCH]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Please enable the sprinkler schedule and set the flow rate to 15 liters per minute.

The user wants to enable the sprinkler schedule and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute.

Step-by-step:
1. Use Enable Schedule command to enable the schedule.
2. Use Set Flow Rate command with parameter 15 to set the flow rate within the allowed 0-20 liters/min range.

Result: Send ENABLE_SCH command and SET_FLOW(15) to enable the schedule and set flow rate to 15 liters per minute.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

      Parameter 1: []

USER QUERY:
Could you open the blinds halfway and tilt them to 30 degrees?

The user wants to set the blinds position to 50% (halfway open) and tilt angle to 30 degrees.

Step-by-step:
1. Use Set Position command with parameter 50 to open blinds halfway (within 0-100%).
2. Use Set Tilt command with parameter 30 degrees, which is within the allowed -90 to 90 degrees range.

Result: Send SET_POS(50) and SET_TILT(30) commands to open the blinds halfway and tilt them to 30 degrees.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Internal Temperature
      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Mode
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Eco [1]
        Vacation [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Set Power Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Normal [0]
          Eco [1]
          Vacation [2]
    Query Status [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the fridge to eco mode and lower the temperature to 4 degrees Celsius.

The user wants to set the power mode to Eco (1) and temperature to 4 °C, which is within the allowed 1 to 10 °C range.

Step-by-step:
1. Use Set Power Mode command with parameter 1 to switch to Eco mode.
2. Use Set Temperature command with parameter 4 to lower the internal temperature.

Result: Send SET_MODE(1) and SET_TEMP(4) commands to set the fridge to eco mode and 4 °C temperature.
